They are all children of the Bundesliga, the league where they developed into stars of world format – whether thanks to excellent youth academy work, or equally excellent scouting.In our special report “Hungry for Success – the Bundesliga’s Bright Young Stars” we go behind the scenes at some of Germany’s top clubs. The Bundesliga has a long-established reputation for taking top prospects up to the next level. Every year, in one of the world’s strongest leagues, new stars are born and fresh foundations laid for extraordinary football careers.

programme.desc: The 2025 U-17 Africa Cup of Nations is the 15th edition of the biennial African youth football tournament organized by Confederation of African Football (CAF) for players aged 17 and below. Morocco was chosen as the host of this edition The top 10 teams will qualify for the 2025 FIFA U-17 World Cup in Qatar as the CAF representatives. It is the first U-17 Africa Cup of Nations to feature 16 teams. Senegal are the defending champions.

It is the first U-17 Africa Cup of Nations to feature 16 teams. Senegal are the defending champions.

programme.title: Aryna Sabalenka vs Madison Keys (USA) - Womens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian Open
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka faces Madison Keys in the Australian Open women’s singles final. Sabalenka, the World No. 1, dominates their head-to-head 4-1 and looks unstoppable on Rod Laver Arena, riding a 20-match winning streak. Keys, ranked 19th, delivers a stunning run, defeating top seeds, including Iga Swiatek, with improved form under her husband-coach Bjorn Fratangelo. A clash of power and precision unfolds as they battle for the title.

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Alexander Zverev (GER) -Mens Singles Final - Road Laver Arena - Australian O
programme.desc: The 2025 Australian Open men’s singles final sees defending champion and World No. 1 Jannik Sinner taking on World No. 2 Alexander Zverev. Sinner chases his third Grand Slam title after dominating Ben Shelton in the semifinals. Zverev, still in search of his first Grand Slam title, advanced after Novak Djokovic retired due to injury. A thrilling battle unfolds, with Sinner’s aggressive play clashing against Zverev’s powerful serves and groundstrokes.

programme.title: A. Kovacevic (USA) vs F. Auger Aliassime (CAN) - Final - Occitanie Open - ATP 250 - Montpellier 202
programme.desc: The 2025 Open Sud de France final in Montpellier sees qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic (USA) take on second seed Felix Auger-Aliassime (CAN). Kovacevic, making a stunning run from the qualifiers, aims for his maiden ATP title, while Auger-Aliassime, a former finalist in Montpellier, looks to secure his first trophy of the season. With Kovacevics resilience and Auger-Aliassime’s firepower, the final promises an intense battle for the championship.

programme.title: The Racket "Story of John McEnroes"
programme.desc: The Racket tells the story of John McEnroes unique history at the Australian Open, including insights and reflection from all the key parties involved with his infamous 1990 Australian Open disqualification

programme.title: M1 - Barcelona Open - BancSabadell 2025 - ATP 500
programme.desc: The 2025 Barcelona Open Banc Sabadell (ATP 500) runs from April 14–20 at the Real Club de Tenis Barcelona. With a reduced 32-player draw, top names like Carlos Alcaraz, Tsitsipas, and Ruud headline the clay-court event. This edition also marks the first without Rafael Nadal and includes a tribute to Bjorn Borg on the 50th anniversary of his 1975 win.

programme.title: Sprint Race - Qatar GP - Moto GP
programme.desc: The 2025 MotoGP Qatar Grand Prix Sprint Race at Lusail International Circuit is a short-format race covering half the distance of the main event. Riders compete for championship points, with the top nine finishers earning points on a sliding scale: 12 points for first place, 9 for second, 7 for third, and so on down to 1 point for ninth place. This sprint offers an additional challenge and opportunity for riders to gain crucial points ahead of the main race.

programme.title: EPL Stories 2024/25 - Title Run In
programme.desc: PL Stories takes a look at the forgotten moments that truly defined a Premier League season, offering new perspectives on the games that shaped title races. As the season nears its conclusion, two former Premier League players alongside two football experts revisit Iconic yet often overlooked moments, such as Steven Gerrards Infamous slip In 2014, which many believe ended Liverpools title charge. But could it have actually been the following match, when Liverpool let a three-goal lead slip against Crystal Palace, that sealed their fate? Our experts debate these key moments and challenge the common narratives that have shaped Premier League history, sparking fresh conversation on what reall

programme.title: EPL The Big Interview 2024/25 - Robert Pires
programme.desc: This week on The Big Interview, two-time Premier League champion, Robert Pires sits down to talk through his career and all things Arsenal. Having joined the club during Arsene Wengers reign, Pires played in one of the greatest sides in the clubs history - as well as helping them achieve Invincible status In 2003/04. The French winger recalls almost quitting football at a young age and how his mother persuaded him to change his mind, winning the World Cup with France, the difficulties he faced when he first joined the Gunners and what this current Arsenal side need to do to win the Premier League title once again

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Salah
programme.desc: Exploring the importance of prayer within Islam, the episode begins with an overview of our seven athletes as they introduce themselves and why Islam is so important to them. We are also introduced to Omar Sulieman, a notable Imam, who acts as narration throughout the series and a guiding voice on the key principles of Islam. The life and career of Sofyan Amrabat is explored, showcasing his role as a key part of the Fenerbahce team in Turkey and the Moroccan national side. The Atlas Lions’ run to the semi-finals of the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 is explored, with the impact that Salah played in the team’s belief and positivity throughout the tournament.

programme.title: Match 1 - ATP 500 - Munich - BMW OPEN - 2025
programme.desc: The 2025 BMW Open in Munich makes its debut as an ATP 500 event, elevating its status on the professional tennis calendar. Held on the clay courts of MTTC Iphitos, the tournament features a 32-player singles draw and offers enhanced facilities, including a new 6,500-seat center court. This marks a significant step forward for one of Germany’s most historic and prestigious tennis events.

programme.title: Cannes vs Montpellier - Marmara Spike ligue Volleyball 2024
programme.desc: The LNV Ligue A Masculine (LAM), currently known as the Marmara SpikeLigue for sponsorship reasons, is the top-tier mens volleyball league in France, established in 1938. Governed by the Ligue Nationale de Volley (LNV) under the French Volleyball Federation (FFVB), the league features Frances elite volleyball talent. Formerly called Pro A until 2009, it shares a rich history and prestige akin to its basketball counterpart.

programme.title: Qatar Prix de lArc de Triomphe 2024 Highlight
programme.desc: The Qatar Arc de Triomphe Horse Racing Festival is considered one of the strongest races in the world, in which the most famous owners in the world, the best horses, the best trainers and the strongest riders participate. The horse Al Ghadeer was able to continue his successive victories, awaiting the crowning with the Triple Crown in the Emir of Qatar Sword in February 2025 after his victory in Qatar Goodwood and the Arc de Triomphe in Paris.

programme.title: PSG vs Toulouse - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germains 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: World Sailing Show 2025
programme.desc: The World Sailing Show 2025 brings you the most thrilling moments from elite sailing competitions around the globe. Meet the world’s best sailors, explore cutting-edge boat technology, and witness the drama of high-stakes racing on the water.
